issue.body:
# Sorry. The website is infected by AdShield, Inc.

Unfortunately, It is complicated to resolve with a regular adblock rule because the website is being protected by service of Ad-Shield that is an anti-adblock company.

## Userscript Installation
Please block Ad-Shield advertisement by installing [tinyShield userscript](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield).
Please check its installation guideline written in English by visiting [this URL](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.md).

If you can understand Korean language, please refer https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/blob/main/README.ko.md.

<details>
<summary>Detailed description for iOS users</summary>

1. Install [**Usercripts**](https://apps.apple.com/us/app/userscripts/id1463298887) app
2. Enable **Usercripts** extension in Safari settings
	* iOS 18+: `System settings` => `Apps` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	* iOS 17 and older: `System settings` => `Safari` => `Extensions`
	Find **Usercripts**, enable it and allow `On other sites` permission
3. Open the [tinyShield ](https://cdn.jsdelivr.net/npm/@filteringdev/tinyshield@latest/dist/tinyShield.user.js) userscript URL in browser
4. Press the extensions icon in the address bar of Safari and select Userscripts 
5. Tap to install
6. In opened popup, scroll down and press Install button
7. Done.

</details>

## Still Have a Problem?
An issue is occurred when the userscript is applied, please report to [this issue tracker](https://github.com/FilteringDev/tinyShield/issues).

comment.body:
> When Disconnect is enabled, certain sites do not load. One in particular is Nextdoor. When Disconnect is disabled, the site loads with no issues.


The adblocker that you used an adblocker's report system for your issue is AdGuard. Not [Disconnect](https://disconnect.me/).

comment.body: @ghajini Thank you for working on this, but there is a misunderstanding regarding my report. First off, would it be possible please to revert the size of the middle `box containers` to their previous, smaller dimensions? Further more I notice that this element here... is removed or blocked: I didn't intend to report this specific element as the issue. I simply marked it with my red arrow in my screenshot to indicate `where` I was clicking when the `new tab ad` is triggered. Since these three clickable boxes are essential features for the page's functionality, removing them is counterintuitive, as it effectively disables the core purpose the webpage is designed for. My primary concern is actually only about the `new tab ad`. This is still active and seems to be triggered everywhere after clicking on the webpage. I didn't test for this beforehand, as I wouldn't have expected that behavior. Therefore, the main issue isn't resolved yet. I have attached a recording to clarify exactly what behavior I am observing and why I opened this ticket: [https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed9122f1-6254-49a7-8567-15aacff84923](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/ed9122f1-6254-49a7-8567-15aacff84923)

### Issue URL (Annoyance) [https://www.google.com/search?q=%E6%B0%B4%E5%B9%B3%E7%B7%9A+%E6%AD%8C%E8%A9%9E](https://adguardteam.github.io/AnonymousRedirect/redirect.html?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.google.com%2Fsearch%3Fq%3D%25E6%25B0%25B4%25E5%25B9%25B3%25E7%25B7%259A%2B%25E6%25AD%258C%25E8%25A9%259E) ### Comment > #223635 > `@zloyden` > > The problem persists in my environment (even if I update the filter, I can't copy it on the same page). I was able to solve it by changing the following user rules, so could you please check and add this rule? > > google.*#$#div[data-lyricid] { user-select: text!important; -webkit-user-select: text!important; -moz-user-select: text!important; -ms-user-select: text!important; } > > Thank you for always dealing with the issues on the Japanese site. ### Screenshots

I checked it on the smartphone and didn't have that. However, I don't see any statistics for the website, so the rules won't be added.

```adblock
||sg.twatchu.com/*/js/otherad.js
/sg\.twatchu\.com\/js\/[a-zA-Z0-9-_]{50,110}\.js$/$script,~third-party,domain=sg.twatchu.com
```

comment.body:
Have you disabled the custom filter? What do you have in the filtering log? If that doesn't help, please do the following:
1. Leave only AdGuard Base
2. Open filtering log (FL)
3. Reproduce the problem
4. Return to FL
5. Export all
6. Send it in zip archive here.

comment.body:
我觉得有必要结束这场争论。我遇到了问题，我提出了问题，我指出的问题的根本在于规则太过主观不符合要求，然后我获得了什么——作者的辩解。他觉得他没错，那对，都是我的错，我花时间去查找解决我遇到的问题，花时间去提出问题，我不该这样做，对吗。我提出了反驳，然后我遭到了作者拥簇者的围攻，说我的反驳不对，然后开始找各种站不住脚理由。唉。。。我确实错了，我把开源社区想的太好了，本质上还是小圈子文化罢了。
@Alex-302 Please lock this issue as there is no need to discuss it further. Thank you
